intro: Crepis mollis subsp. velenovskyi, commonly known as the Velenovsky's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks. It has small, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its use in traditional herbal medicine.
